tools.label: Web Panel Sample Service (WPSS)
tools.description:
WPSS stands for Web Panel Sample Service. It is a web application paired with the Qualtrics survey platform to meet the specific needs of cross-national web surveys, for the social sciences and beyond.
WPSS enables:
- a centralised management of survey fielding orchestration (publishing, sending invites and reminders),
- and decentralised and privacy-compliant handling of panelist data.

WPSS, The Web Panel Sample Service has been specified and developped within the framework of SSHOC, the Social Sciences and Humanities Open Cloud H2020, as part of the Work Package "Innovations in data production", led by ESS-ERIC. The software was developped by the CDSP's IT team at Sciences Po.

Use cases can be found in the Social Sciences and Humanities but may extend to broader contexts as well. Starting October 2021, a new release of the WPSS will support its first full-scale use case, within the frame of the European Social Survey for the web panel spinoff of ESS round 10, Opinion Survey for "Country" also known as the CRONOS-2 project.

concept.label: CSV
concept.definition: A comma-separated values (CSV) file is a delimited text file that uses a comma to separate values. A CSV file stores tabular data (numbers and text) in plain text. Each line of the file is a data record. Each record consists of one or more fields, separated by commas. The use of the comma as a field separator is the source of the name for this file format. RFC 4180 formalized CSV. It defines the MIME type "text/csv", and CSV files that follow its rules should be very widely portable

concept.label: DDI
concept.definition: The Data Documentation Initiative (also known as DDI or DDI Metadata) is an international standard for describing surveys, questionnaires, statistical data files, and social sciences study-level information. This information is described as metadata by the standard.

relatedItems.label: European Social Survey as a service
relatedItems.description:
The European Social Survey (ESS) is a cross-national survey based on scientific standards that has been conducted every two years since 2001. The ESS collects data on attitudes and behaviour patterns of the population in more than 30 European countries. The survey data are provided by the ESS-ERIC (ERIC = European Research Infrastructure Consortium). In cooperation with national institutions, data from interviews on attitudes, beliefs and behavioural patterns are collected throughout Europe. 

ESS data curation, dissemination and storage have been moved to the cloud. The FAIRness of ESS data holdings has increased through a powerful search tool, automated data processing, increased compliance with standards, controlled vocabularies and persistent identifiers as well as more interoperable metadata. 

The new ESS data and metadata service consists of multiple data and metadata repositories to support an efficient, collaborative, version-controlled data archive workflow. The service makes use of the Colectica software solutions for metadata management and the Azure cloud for data storage and management. The repositories are accessed via ESS API for management and dissemination of data and metadata.

The Colectica software solutions and cloud storage for data enables powerful data search, analysis, visualization and download services by adhering to the DDI Lifecycle Metadata Standard. The new ESS service has made ESS data more findable – for humans and machines. DOIs at study and dataset levels allow easier data reuse

concept.label: Creative Commons Attribution Share Alike 4.0 International

tools.label: WebSlides
tools.description: WebSlides allows you to convert your bookmarks and feeds to present them as live web pages in an interactive slideshow. Each WebSlide has a unique URL, or comes as a widget. Users may create a guided tour of any website, group course information for students, provide a simple tutorial on any subject, or share images on the web. Additionally, content publishers may use this presentation format for repacking and remixing content.

tools.label: WebSty
tools.description: Similarity and clustering of texts in Polish. The tools used include: Morfeusz 2 with SGJP dictionary (for morphological analysis), wcrft2 (for tagging), Liner2 (for named entities recognition), Fextor (for extraction of feaures from texts); Cluto (for clustering), result visualisation: D3.js, D3-tip. For zip files with content in English, German, Russian, Hungarian, and Spanish, users are redirected to WebStyML.

tools.description: Whatizit can ingest up to 500,000 terms pasted into the input box and execute any of the pre-defined text analysis pipelines.

tools.label: Widen
tools.description:
A marketing technology company offering cloud-based digital asset management that facilitates finding/organizing/sharing images, and media files (video, etc.) Although pricing is custom built based on required features and users, they do offer discounts for non-profit and education institutions.

Features include:

On-the-fly file conversions for images, audio \& video,

Image watermarking,

Unlimited user roles with configurable permissions,

Fully configurable metadata schema with read/write ability,

Asset group level security for lifecycle management.

tools.label: Wideo
tools.description:
Wideo (www.wideo.co ) is a DIY online video animation tool that makes it simple to create marketing-focused video animations. Create, edit, and share videos from scratch or choose to edit one of Wideo's fully customizable, marketing-focused templates. Upload music and voice tracks, add a company logo, customize the color palette, and more in the user-friendly Wideo editor for top quality branded content.



Wideo produces results for its users. Certain customers have seen:

Increased email marketing conversions by 10x after including Wideo's video in emails.

Social traffic growth by 300% after putting a Wideo video on social pages.

Overall ROI on marketing campaigns increased 12x.

tools.label: Wiggio
tools.description:
Wiggio was a free service that allowed users to create groups, host virtual meetings and conference calls, manage events, create to-do lists, poll members, send messages, and upload and manage folders. You could connect with your Facebook account or create a new and free account with Wiggio. They are no longer supporting previously available Wiggio apps.
Wiggio has shut down, and the site is only a placeholder, now.

tools.label: Wikidot
tools.description: Wikidot is a web application service that allows you to create a traditional wiki, forum, or blog. Wikidot is also a large community with an active question and answer forum.

tools.label: Wiki Map Project
tools.description: Wiki Map Project was designed by Protovis and jQuery to visualize the data provided by Wikipedia. The program provides data animation and graph visualization with an option to explore the nodes connections.

tools.label: WikiMindMap
tools.description: WikiMindMap is a mindmapping tool that allows you to browse in wiki content. It uses an interactive interface based on a system of nodes and brackets. Maps may be exported into FreeMind.

concept.label: Data Visualization
concept.definition: creation and study of the visual representation of data (Wikidata contributors, "Q6504956," Wikidata, https://www.wikidata.org/w/index.php?title=Q6504956&oldid=1258700005 (accessed September 4, 2020).

tools.label: WikiPack
tools.description:
WikiPack is a web based personal information organizer and Markdown editor that uses Dropbox for synced storage. Using plain text Markdown files and WikiWords, WikiPack gives information context and links entries together by turning your Markdown pages into a private, password protected wiki. The easy to use Markdown language lets you create and edit your wiki pages without having to learn complex wiki syntax. WikiPack features page history/versioning and visual change comparisons in the browser-based GUI and store all of your files in your Dropbox account.

You can import existing markdown files to sync WikiPack with other apps and services using Dropbox, or use the quick-start template to set up new wikis.

WikiPack includes a GUI markdown editor with syntax highlighting, built-in markdown reference, support for Multimarkdown table, and toolbar buttons with keyboard shortcuts and tools for common formatting. WikiPack works in the browser so you can use it on any desktop or mobile device that has an internet connection and Dropbox functionality.

tools.label: Wink
tools.description: Wink is a tutorial and presentation creation software, that allows you to create tutorials on how to use software, by capturing screenshots, mouse movements, and accompanying audio.

tools.label: WIScker
tools.description: WIScker is a tool for generating corpi from Wikipedia articles. It takes all of the various versions and edits of an article over time and creates a comparative corpus out of them. The corpus can then be analyzed using a built-in button to access voyant tools, or can be exported in a text file in various different formats.

tools.label: Wisdom
tools.description: Wisdom was a word sense disambiguation system that participated in the 1998 SENSEVAL competition. It used a simple supervised learning algorithm, drawing on co-occurrence statistics.

allowedVocabularies.label: ÖFOS 2012. Austrian Fields of Science and Technology Classification 2012

tools.label: WissKI
tools.description:
As a full-featured virtual research environment WissKI is scalable from small single person ventures up to large institutional projects. WissKI is part of the open source content management system Drupal and therefore provides all the advantages of a constantly maintained and developed webapp. WissKI has everything to fulfill the research data lifecycle: beneath the fundamental possibilities to create, read, edit and delete content, users can create revisions and translations, open the access to the data with a wide range of interfaces and integration options, but also restrict it via detailed rights management. The data is stored in an external triple store, reachable trough own endpoints and therefore independent from Drupal or WissKIs architecture. The data modelling follow an ontological approach, preferably, but not exclusively according to the CIDOC CRM. Furthermore, the basic functions of WissKI can be extended with a variety of Drupal modules. This turns WissKI to a software optimized for research data management, and suitable for a wide range of application areas.

WissKI started as a joint venture of the Digital Humanities Research Group of the Department of Computer Science at Friedrich-Alexander University (FAU) in Erlangen, the Department of Museum Informatics at the Germanic National Museum (GNM) in Nuremberg and the Biodiversity Informatics Group at Zoological Research Museum Koenig (ZFMK) in Bonn. The Software development was funded by the German Research Foundation (DFG) from 2008 to 2012 and from 2014 to 2017 and is currently funded by the NFDI4Culture Consortium within the National Research Data Infrastructure (NFDI). WissKI is now supported by the Association for semantic data processing (IGSD e.V.) and has a continuously growing community.

relatedItems.label: Drupal

tools.label: WordHoard
tools.description: WordHoard is a tool for the study of large texts or transcribed speech. It annotates or tags texts by applying morphological, lexical, prosodic, and narratological criteria. Users may apply WordHoard to their own texts, or to the corpora included with the tool. At present, that corpora includes the entire canon of Early Greek epic (original and in translation), Chaucer, Shakespeare and Spencer.

tools.label: WORDij
tools.description: WORDij is a free semantic network tool for capturing relationships between words and assigning word-pair link strengths. This information is used as the basis for more sophisticated analysis, such as word network structure mapping. WORDij requires registration for download.

tools.label: Wordle
tools.description:
Wordle is an online toy for generating [word clouds](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Word_cloud) using the text you provide. Text can be submitted by providing an URL or by pasting raw text into an input. The most frequent words from the text are then used as the source for the resulting visualization, where frequency is used to determine the size of each word.

You may customize the output by choosing from a variety of display options (layout, font, colours) or use the randomize feature to get a random visualization. Additionally, there is built-in stop word support for many common languages, and the option to change the word case.

tools.label: wordsimilarity (Word 2 Word)
tools.description: wordsimilarity (Word 2 Word) is a free, open source tool for plotting and visualizing semantic spaces within a corpus. The tool's visualizations assign words to nodes, with similarities marked by edges between nodes of varying strength. The visualizations are designed to be easy to manipulate based on graph data, and the system includes a library of ready-to-use relationship models with an interface for training the models based on a variety of language sources.

tools.label: WordStat - Content Analysis & Text Mining Software
tools.description:
WordStat is a text analysis module for QDA Miner or SimStat. WordStat combines content analysis method by using dictionary approach and many algorithms exploration or various text mining methods. WordStat can apply existing categorization dictionaries to a new text corpus. It also may be used in the development and validation of new categorization dictionaries. When used in conjunction with manual coding, this module can provide assistance for a more systematic application of coding rules, help uncover differences in word usage between subgroups of individuals and assist in the revision of existing coding using KWIC (Keyword In Context) tables. WordStat is specifically designed to study textual information such as responses to open-ended questions, interviews, titles, journal articles, public speeches, electronic communications, etc.

For more information, visit: http://provalisresearch.com/products/content-analysis-software/

tools.label: word tree
tools.description: word tree is a free, web-based tool for generating dynamic word trees from user-supplied texts. Users can paste their text directly in the box provided, enter a URL or Twitter handle in the search bar, or install the bookmarklet into their browser's bookmarks bar to run the tool on their current page. Within the visualization, users can generate trees for any keyword based on search or from a click in the interface, and can reverse the direction of the tree (forward or back from the keyword within the text).

tools.description: WordVenture is an interactive visualization of the WordNet database that employs the technology and interface of TouchGraph.

tools.label: WordWanderer
tools.description: WordWanderer is a free, web-based tool for visualizing and exploring text. It combines search, concordance and word cloud attributes to enable users to explore their texts. Users can paste their own texts into the box provided, or choose from a list of preloaded texts. It includes the ability to include or hide words based on parts of speech, a stop list or a user-provided list, and can display the text based on relative frequency, context or comparison. To view specific words, users can search them or click on them in the visualization.

WorldCat grows every day thanks to the efforts of librarians and other information professionals.

WorldMap is a web-based map collaboration platform hosted at Harvard, which allows anyone to store, organize, visualize, edit, collaborate, and publish geospatial information. Upload your own map layers or use maps others have contributed.

The system attempts to fill the growing gap between powerful desktop-bound mapping applications, and lightweight web map solutions with limited storage capacity.

Writeboards are sharable, web-based text documents. You can use Writeboard on your own or collaboratively, to revise and organize documents, compare different versions of documents, and collaborate on materials.

It's no longer possible to create new Writeboars on Writeboard.com. Existing Writeboards are still available on Writeboard.com and Writeboards are available as a tool in Basecamp (https://basecamp.com/).

tools.label: Writefull

concept.label: Writing
concept.definition: writing designates the activity of creating new texts (instead of capturing existing text). Here, it primarily concerns research papers and reports, but may include other textually-oriented objects.

allowedVocabularies.label: ÖFOS 2012. Austrian Fields of Science and Technology Classification 2012

vocabulary.label: ÖFOS 2012. Austrian Fields of Science and Technology Classification 2012

tools.label: WriteRoom
tools.description: WriteRoom is an alternative to Microsoft Word, that removes distractions on your computer while you're writing. WriteRoom is a full screen writing environment that has certain functions like word count and autosave. WriteRoom for iOS is synced with Dropbox, and your iPhone/iPad/iPod touch.

concept.label: Writing
concept.definition: writing designates the activity of creating new texts (instead of capturing existing text). Here, it primarily concerns research papers and reports, but may include other textually-oriented objects.

tools.label: Wufoo
tools.description: Wufoo is an online form builder with built-in analytics. Free users are allowed to create up to three forms with up to 10 fields. The forms created can be used for a variety of purposes like registration, research data collection, payment collection, etc. The data gathered can be analyzed inside Wufoo or exported to popular spreadsheet formats

tools.label: Xalan
tools.description:
Xalan is an XSLT processor for transforming XML documents into HTML, text, or other XML document types. It implements XSL Transformations (XSLT) Version 1.0 and XML Path Language (XPath) Version 1.0.

Features:

Conversion between structured markup formats

Stylesheet validation

tools.label: Xena
tools.description: Xena is free and open source software developed by the National Archives of Australia to aid in the long term preservation of digital records. Xena is an acronym meaning Xml Electronic Normalising for Archives. Xena is a component of the Digital Preservation Software Platform (DPSP). Xena software aids digital preservation by performing two important tasks: detecting the file formats of digital objects and converting digital objects into open formats for preservation.

tools.label: Xendo
tools.description: Xendo is an online research tool that provides unified search across cloud-based storage (such as Dropbox, Evernote, Google Drive, OneDrive) and email (such as Gmail, Office 365) and other services such as Slack, Trello and Asana (25 integrations to-date). Xendo offers advanced search capabilities such as proximity searching (looking for term or phrase within a number of words of a second term or phrase). Xendo uses OCR (Optical Character Recognition) to make scanned documents searchable. For some services, Xendo offers a content preview to speed research.

tools.label: XGLab - X and Gamma Ray Electronics
tools.description: The core-business of XGLab is the development of high-performance electronics and instrumentation for X-ray and Gamma-ray applications.

relatedItems.label: Describe measurement. Measurement / Spectra            acquisition / Storage of data and metadata files
relatedItems.description: Record data taken on representative sites on the CH object. A preliminary evaluation of the spectrum is relevant (assessement of major, minor elements present) Store data and metadata files The measurment conditions (Voltage, current, acquisition time, any filter used) are documented in a text file for all the measurements or in form of metadata file for each spectrum file.

tools.label: XMetal
tools.description:
XML-based software application for structured authoring and editing documents and content collaboration.





Features:

Spellchecker, thesaurus, track changes and other word processing functionality

Configurable document view (normal, tagged, plain text)



Resource Manager may be used to locate and insert items such as image files and text fragments.

tools.label: XML to TEILex0
tools.description:
This is a Python script designed to partially automatize the creation of dictionary lemmas according to the standards for digital lexicography of [TEILex0](https://dariah-eric.github.io/lexicalresources/pages/TEILex0/TEILex0.html). 

Dictionary entries created and edited with a text processing software such as MSWord or its open equivalent should be first converted to basic mark-up in [TEI OxGarage](https://oxgarage.tei-c.org/). The resulting .xml file can serve as input for the app which then converts the basic XML to TEILex0 XML. The app is in development and more advanced versions which are more up-to-date with the latest developments of the TEILex0 guidelines are currently being prepared.

allowedVocabularies.label: ÖFOS 2012. Austrian Fields of Science and Technology Classification 2012

vocabulary.label: ÖFOS 2012. Austrian Fields of Science and Technology Classification 2012

concept.label: Data Visualization
concept.definition: creation and study of the visual representation of data (Wikidata contributors, "Q6504956," Wikidata, https://www.wikidata.org/w/index.php?title=Q6504956&oldid=1258700005 (accessed September 4, 2020).

concept.label: Encoding
concept.definition: process of creating a message for transmission (Wikidata contributors, "Q5375490," Wikidata, https://www.wikidata.org/w/index.php?title=Q5375490&oldid=1224419731 (accessed July 30, 2020).

allowedVocabularies.label: ÖFOS 2012. Austrian Fields of Science and Technology Classification 2012

vocabulary.label: ÖFOS 2012. Austrian Fields of Science and Technology Classification 2012

concept.label: XML
concept.definition: Extensible Markup Language (XML) is a markup language that defines a set of rules for encoding documents in a format that is both human-readable and machine-readable.

concept.label: TEI
concept.definition: The Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) is a text-centric community of practice in the academic field of digital humanities, operating continuously since the 1980s. The community currently runs a mailing list, meetings and conference series, and maintains an eponymous technical standard, a journal, a wiki, a GitHub repository and a toolchain.

tools.label: xMod
tools.description:
xMod is a desktop application which can transform a repository of XML into a completely finished website.



The entire process can be setup and run to produce a basic website assuming some prerequisites:

- a set of valid XML files. These would normally comply with a TEI DTD.

- a configuration script that indicates the relationship between files

- a 'personality pack' (CSS and image files) that determine its visual appearance.



However if they are not present, the completed website falls back on a default look and feel.

Some features include:

- Batch file processing

- Modular XSLT structure, with special libraries for different transformation scenarios

- Ability to group files for generation of indices at document and intra-document level

concept.label: Encoding
concept.definition: process of creating a message for transmission (Wikidata contributors, "Q5375490," Wikidata, https://www.wikidata.org/w/index.php?title=Q5375490&oldid=1224419731 (accessed July 30, 2020).

tools.label: XnView
tools.description: XnView is an image organizer and general-purpose file manager used for viewing, converting, organizing and editing raster images, as well as general purpose file management. It comes with built-in hex inspection, batch renaming and screen capture tools. It is licensed as freeware for private, educational and non-profit uses.

tools.label: Xournal
tools.description: Xournal is an application for note-taking, sketching, and journaling.

tools.label: XSugar
tools.description: XSugar is a tool designed to manage dual syntaxes when working with XML documents, developed by the Department of Computer Science, Aarhus University. From a user-provided specification, XSugar translates between XML syntaxs, and makes statistical checks to ensure transformations will be reliably bidirectional and contain valid syntax in accordance with the schema.

actor.name: Department of Computer Science, Aarhus University

concept.label: Transformation
concept.definition: process involving change into a qualitatively different form (Wikidata contributors, "Q65757353," Wikidata, https://www.wikidata.org/w/index.php?title=Q65757353&oldid=1268189392 (accessed September 4, 2020).

tools.label: XTRACT
tools.description: XTRACT was a tool for lexical collocation developed by Frank Smadja, then of Columbia University. It was designed to use statistical techniques to identify collocations of aribitrary length, and to generate syntactic relationships between words. This tool is no longer available and does not have a web presence.

allowedVocabularies.label: ÖFOS 2012. Austrian Fields of Science and Technology Classification 2012

vocabulary.label: ÖFOS 2012. Austrian Fields of Science and Technology Classification 2012

tools.label: Xtranormal
tools.description: Easy-to-use web-based animation software. Offers educational pricing.

tools.label: YAGO
tools.description: YAGO is a semantic knowledge base of over 10 million entities, and over 120 million facts about those entities, developed by the Max Planck Institut Informatik. Its base derives from Wikipedia, WordNet and GeoNames, and the accuaracy has not only been manually evaluated, but relations are also provided with an annotation stating its confidence value. The YAGO ontology includes spacial and temporal dimensions, and integrates WordNet's thematic domains as well. It can be queried or browsed right from the website, and the full ontology is available for download.

concept.label: Data Visualization
concept.definition: creation and study of the visual representation of data (Wikidata contributors, "Q6504956," Wikidata, https://www.wikidata.org/w/index.php?title=Q6504956&oldid=1258700005 (accessed September 4, 2020).

tools.label: Yāna
tools.description: Yāna provides a free, open-source template that open access journals can use as the basis of their own multi-platform mobile applications. The Yāna template provides the basic functionality required by any journal operating on a mobile platform.

allowedVocabularies.label: The Bibliographic Ontology (bibo) Concept Scheme (parts used in SSHOC)

vocabulary.label: The Bibliographic Ontology (bibo) Concept Scheme (parts used in SSHOC)

tools.label: yED Files
tools.description:
yWorks is a powerful set of tools for creating diagrams using any number of frameworks. There are tools for working with HTML, FLEX, AJAX, Silverlight, Java and .NET.



yEd is also available from the yWorks site. This free graph editor can be used to create diagrams manually, or to import data for analysis.

concept.label: Data Visualization
concept.definition: creation and study of the visual representation of data (Wikidata contributors, "Q6504956," Wikidata, https://www.wikidata.org/w/index.php?title=Q6504956&oldid=1258700005 (accessed September 4, 2020).

tools.label: Yojimbo
tools.description: Yojimbo is an information organizer software that allows you to store text, images, PDFs, and passwords; organize information with tags and labels; export a copy of your data to your mobile device; and search all of Yojimbo content. Licenses available for individual, family, or educational use.

tools.label: Yoshikoder
tools.description: Yoshikoder is a free, open source cross-platform content analysis program. It works with text documents to apply basic content analysis in any language, examine KWIC, generate summaries and generate content analysis dictionaries.

tools.label: Your Twapper Keeper
tools.description: TwapperKeeper is now called Hootsuite Archives and can be accessed from within Hootsuite.

tools.label: YouTube
tools.description: http://www.wikidata.org/entity/Q16971117

relatedItems.label: An update on automatic transcription vs. manual transcription (abstract)
Many Tongues, Multiple Networks - A Corpus-Based Pragmatic Study of Multilingualism on Nigerian Virtual Political Space
"My Name is Lizzie Bennet - " Reading, Participation, and Jane Austen Across Media Platforms
Rewards - Books, Boundedness and Reading in Participatory Culture

tools.label: YouTube Comment Scraper
tools.description: This free web-based tool allows you to scrape the comments from a YouTube video and save them in either a JSON or CSV format. The project is open source, and its code is available on github.

tools.label: YouTube Data Tools
tools.description: YouTube Data Tools is a collection of simple utilities for extracting data from this platform such as Channel information and Related Videos networks.

tools.label: Youtube Scraper CSV Cleaner
tools.description: A very simple/specialized piece of Java code that takes a csv file produced by "Youtube Comment Scraper" - http://ytcomments.klostermann.ca/ and collapses the replies down into the same categories that basic comments are under. This makes it easier to compare all comments to each other.NOTE: The name of the csv file to be parsed has to be written into the code, assigned to the variable "inFile".

tools.label: Yutzu
tools.description: Yutzu is a collaborative tool for collecting and publishing multimedia content online, offered by the Cultureplex Lab at the University of Western Ontario. It is a web environment, designed to assist in the creative process, publication and visualization, and integrating a variety of multimedia tools. Yutzu has been used to showcase work, curate exhibitions and collections, and to facilitate teaching and learning.

concept.label: Data Visualization
concept.definition: creation and study of the visual representation of data (Wikidata contributors, "Q6504956," Wikidata, https://www.wikidata.org/w/index.php?title=Q6504956&oldid=1258700005 (accessed September 4, 2020).

tools.label: Zamzar
tools.description: Zamzar is an online file conversion service. Zamzar converts between a wide variety of formats (including support for word processing documents, audio, images, video, and ebooks) and emails the result to the user. There is a monthly subscription fee that depends on the volume of data converted. It also has storage services.

tools.label: Zandy
tools.description: Zandy provides users with access to their Zotero library through a simple interface. Users can browse and modify the items in their libraries, add new items, view attachments, take and edit item notes, search their libraries, and add webpages from the Android browser.

tools.label: Zapier
tools.description:
Zapier provides a means to create on-the-fly data connections between applications which may not have open API's. Zapier works with a wide range of popular applications - a list of current ones is available at: https://zapier.com/zapbook/apps/.



The creation of Zaps (specific trigger -action definitions) is done using a simply graphical interface and can perform and wide variety of tasks. Examples include: receive a tweet and add it to a row in a google spreadsheet; add a card to trello from an email; post to Facebook from an RSS feed.

tools.label: ZeeMaps
tools.description:
ZeeMaps quickly maps point data on Google base maps in two ways:

1) The user uploads a .csv file of data points and their locations.

2) A group of users all add their own data location points to the map, on their own time from their own devices.

Each point can include text, video, image, or audio annotations.

Basic functionality is free; larger uploads and large numbers of maps require a paid subscription.

concept.label: Data Visualization
concept.definition: creation and study of the visual representation of data (Wikidata contributors, "Q6504956," Wikidata, https://www.wikidata.org/w/index.php?title=Q6504956&oldid=1258700005 (accessed September 4, 2020).

tools.label: Zenodo
tools.description: Zenodo is a catch-all repository for research data. It accepts all research data, with no requirements on format, size, access restrictions, or license. It is intended to support storage, curation, and publication of big research data. It was developed by the OpenAIRE partner CERN, responding to a request by the European Commission to create an open catch-all repository for all EC funded research.

tools.label: ZingChart
tools.description:
JavaScript Charts

The developer's solution for visualizing data in web apps.

Build a comprehensive dashboard with ZingChart using a combination of map, bar, area and pie charts. Analyze and export multiple data sources in a single data visualization.

concept.label: Data Visualization
concept.definition: creation and study of the visual representation of data (Wikidata contributors, "Q6504956," Wikidata, https://www.wikidata.org/w/index.php?title=Q6504956&oldid=1258700005 (accessed September 4, 2020).

tools.label: Zoho
tools.description: Zoho provides a drag-and-drop interface for creating database-driven applications, such as forms.

tools.label: Zoomerang
tools.description: Zoomerang is online survey software. Users create and share their survey forms. It had the ability to export forms from Survey Monkey. It can be used for free but the paid plans include analysis tools. Zommerang is now part of Survey Monkey.

concept.label: Data Visualization
concept.definition: creation and study of the visual representation of data (Wikidata contributors, "Q6504956," Wikidata, https://www.wikidata.org/w/index.php?title=Q6504956&oldid=1258700005 (accessed September 4, 2020).

tools.label: Zoomify
tools.description:
A suite of products developed for web designers that may be used to convert large images into a form that can be zoomed and panned. Zoomify enables large images to be viewed and manipulated, without an increase in server load or download time. It converts large images stored in raster formats (e.g. TIFF, JPEG) into a set of pieces or 'tiles' The individual pieces contain sub-sections of the image at different resolutions or levels of zoom, which are combined to create a type of mosaic.

Features:

Enables access to high quality still images without an increase in server load

tools.label: Zotero
tools.description: Zotero is a free tool that collects, manages and cites research sources. It stays on your web browser where you do your work and it's easy to use. It's being downloaded as a firefox extension, used with the chrome and safari browsers or used as a standalone tool. It allows you to attach pdfs, notes and images to your citations, organise them into easily searchable collections for different projects, and open office using any of over 2800 citation styles. references can be added to a zotero library in many different ways: directly from databases, journal websites, google scholar or the library catalogue, by referencing file import ( for example from an Endnote library), by dragging in pdfs from your hard drive, and by entering them manually.

tools.label: ZotFile
tools.description:
Zotero add-on for Firefox to manage your attachments: automatically rename, move, and attach files to Zotero items, sync PDFs from your Zotero library to your (mobile) PDF reader (e.g. an iPad, Android tablet, etc.) and extract annotations from PDF files.

Attach New Files to Zotero Items

(Batch) Rename and Move Attachments based on Zotero Metadata

Sync PDFs with your iPad or Android tablet

Extract Annotations from PDF Files

tools.label: Zotpress
tools.description: Zotpress is a WordPress plugin that enables users to easily add Zotero citations to a WordPress site by using a special syntax that turns a Zotero citation key into a well-formatted inline citation and bibliography, based on the data stored in Zotero.

tools.label: Zubrag HTML Tags Stripper
tools.description: This tool simply takes HTML and returns it without the HTML tags.
